headline: Oscars to air on YouTube: What it means for media industry
summary: The Oscars will be streaming on Alphabet-owned (GOOG, GOOGL) YouTube, rather than Disney-owned (DIS) ABC, starting in 2029. The shift marks a win for streaming over traditional cable television. "The Ankler" awards editor Katey Rich explains what the Oscars' move to YouTube means for the media industry. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.
